circuit-sat.name: Circuit-SAT
circuit-sat.description: Does a boolean circuit have a satisfying assignment?

cnf-sat.name: CNF-SAT
cnf-sat.description: Does a boolean formula in conjunctive normal form have a satisfying assignment?

3-sat.name: 3-CNF-SAT
3-sat.description: Does a boolean formula in conjunctive normal form, where each clause has exactly 3 literals, have a satisfying assignment?

indset.name: Independent Set
indset.description: Is there a subset of size at least k of vertices of an undirected graph such that no 2 vertices in the subset have an edge between them in the graph?

vertex-cover.name: Vertex Cover
vertex-cover.description: Is there a subset of size at most k of vertices of an undirected graph such that every edge has an endpoint in the subset?

clique.name: Clique
clique.description: Does a graph have a complete subgraph of size k?

set-cover.name: Set Cover
set-cover.description: Given a set U and some of its subsets, are there k subsets whose union is U?

ham-cycle.name: Hamiltonian Cycle
ham-cycle.description: Given an undirected graph on n vertices, does it have a cycle of length n?

tsp.name: Travelling Salesman Problem
tsp.description: Given a weighted complete graph, is there a hamiltonian cycle of weight at most w?

subset-sum.name: Subset Sum
subset-sum.description: Given a set S of integers and an integer k, does a subset of S sum to k?

ilp.name: Integer Linear Programming
ilp.description: Solving a linear program where the variables can only take integral values.

partition.name: Set Partitioning
partition.description: Given set of numbers, partition it into 2 subsets such that they both have the same sum.

best-partition.name: Best Set Partitioning
best-partition.description: Given set of numbers, partition it into 2 subsets such that the difference between their sums is at most d.

ham-path.name: Hamiltonian Path
ham-path.description: Given an undirected graph on n vertices, does it have a simple path of length n-1?

knapsack.name: Knapsack
knapsack.description: Given n items, each with a certain profit and size, and given a knapsack of limited capacity, can we pack a subset of items to get a profit ≥ P?

3-color.name: Graph 3-coloring
3-color.description: Given a graph, is it possible to color each vertex with one of 3 colors so that no 2 adjacent vertices have the same color?

d-ham-path.name: Directed Hamiltonian Path
d-ham-path.description: Given a directed graph on n vertices, does it have a path of length n-1?

d-ham-cycle.name: Directed Hamiltonian Cycle
d-ham-cycle.description: Given a directed graph on n vertices, does it have a cycle of length n?

makespan.name: Makespan scheduling
makespan.description: Given n jobs to run on k processors and the time required for each job, is it possible to finish all jobs in time ≤ T?

bin-packing.name: Bin Packing
bin-packing.description: Given the size of n items, can they be packed in k bins of capacity C?

max-cut.name: Max cut
max-cut.description: Given a graph G = (V, E), find a partitioning (S, V-S) such that E∩(S×(V-S)) is maximized.
